alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 7:05AM CDT until October 26 at 8:07PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork Trinity River At Grand Prairie affecting Dallas and Tarrant Counties. Elm Fork Trinity River Near Carrollton affecting Dallas County. Walnut Creek Near Mansfield affecting Tarrant County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Rowlett Creek Near Sachse affecting Dallas County. ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave affecting Dallas County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Rock Creek near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 88.0 feet, Moderate flooding will occur along the creek. Ball fields at Moss Park are completely flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 88.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 84.0 feet. - Flood stage is 84.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning and continue falling to 70.2 feet Tuesday morning. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
